intro: Eriogonum rydbergii, commonly known as the Rydberg's buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, showy white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, oval-shaped leaves and produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Eriogonum rydbergii plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and maintaining ecological balance in its native range.
